#summary The tr valign attribute specifies the vertical alignment of the element within its bounding box.
#labels about-html,about-tables,is-html-attribute,from-w3c

You are here: [Welcome Home] > [HTMLReference HTML Reference] > [HTMLElements Elements] > [TrElement <tr> element] > *valign attribute*

== Usage ==

The `align` attribute is deprecated in favor of the [TextAlignCSSProperty text-align CSS property], but browsers still support it.

== Values ==

  * `left` (default)
  * `center`
  * `right`

== Elements ==

You can use the `valign` attribute on the following elements:

  * [CaptionElement <caption>]
  * [ColElement <col>]
  * [ColgroupElement <colgroup>]
  * [TbodyElement <tbody>]
  * [TdElement <td>]
  * [ThElement <th>]
  * [TfootElement <tfoot>]
  * [TheadElement <thead>]
  * [TrElement <tr>]
